metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20807 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Vim before 8.1.0881, users can circumvent the rvim restricted mode and execute arbitrary OS commands via scripting interfaces (e.g., Python, Ruby, or Lua).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5').
